examples: to his distress he saw that she was trembling
I didn't mean to distress you
he was distressed to find that Anna would not talk to him

verb.description: Give (furniture, leather, or clothing) simulated marks of age and wear.
examples: the manner in which leather jackets are industrially distressed

origin: Middle English: from Old French destresce (noun), destrecier (verb), based on Latin distringere stretch apart.
